{"step_by_step_thinking": "The contractile element in a myofibril is the sarcomere. The sarcomere is the functional unit of muscle contraction and is composed of overlapping thick and thin filaments. The H band is a region within the sarcomere that contains only thick filaments, the sarcoplasm is the cytoplasm of the muscle cell, and the A line is not a recognized component of the sarcomere.", "answer_choice": "C. Sarcomere"}
